availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky, farmer. South Carolina native. Married to Mary Miller. Father of Nancy Miller, James E. Miller, Samuel A. Miller, and Mary E. Miller. Farmer in Calloway County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Calloway County in 1850. Farmer in Calloway County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 1, p. 464A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 1, p. 855.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, p. 193.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, p. 227A.
"Joseph "Joe" Miller (1812-1875)," Find A Grave, Memorial 24794644, accessed May 15, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/24794644.
